author: Nathan Strubberg
comment: The app is an OK alarm app as it sits now. The calendar sync functions are a little confusing and limiting, but the features it does have work well. I gave it 4 stars because the developer was really response to my questions and concerns and I'm really excited about his future plans for this app. I think with a couple updates that this will be a 5 star, goto alarm app in the near future.

reply.author: FiveZ
reply.content:
Calendar-disabling feature works only on all-day events, not on events with a specific time set on them, even with a Tag set on them.
I can give you a refund if the feature does not meet your needs. Just send me your order id at my email adress.

author: Margaret Hogg
comment: So is this just the demo for a paid app? It would be nice to know that up front. All the alarms I set have disappeared and it's asking me to pay for the full app. 😑

reply.author: FiveZ
reply.content:
Thanks for your review.
There's a message in the app telling how many days are left to test the premium features. After this period, premium features are indeed locked, but all free features are still there.
The demo period is there for the users to make sure the app actually works.
Best regards

author: Waseeque Ahmad
comment: Great app! But does not speak time in Hindi(India) language, even my TTS is set to Hindi(India). Please do something

reply.author: FiveZ
reply.content: Hello, thanks for your review! Unfortunately, I've not received any help to translate the application in Hindi, and I can't do it myself. Therefore, the TTS does not speak in Hindi.

author: مجدى الشريف ادم
comment: It's OK

author: Marc Willemsen
comment: Best alarm app

author: Terrn Lister
comment: Best alarm yet. Great looking and feature filled. One suggestion though, one use disposable alarms, or alarms that delete themselves. This would make it perfect for me, and would certainly earn the pro unlock for me.

reply.author: FiveZ
reply.content:
Thanks for your review!
Could you please send me an email about this? It's easier to work on feature request with email than with PlayStore reviews.
Thanks!

author: Noah Minyard
comment: Great for non typical schedules!

reply.author: FiveZ
reply.content: Thank you for your review!

author: Alex Hover
comment: Best alarm clock I've ever used. The ability to have the alarm speak to you with information about the day after you dismiss it is a huge bonus I haven't seen anywhere else.

reply.author: FiveZ
reply.content: Thanks! I'm working on new features that I hope you'll like 😀

author: Just Randomly
comment: Man now with this app I feel like Tony Stark.!!!!!🙌🙌🙌

reply.author: FiveZ
reply.content: Thanks! I'm sure Tony Stark also wakes up on time

author: Chuck Crombie
comment: Love it.

reply.author: FiveZ
reply.content: Thanks for your review! I'm adding this to the todo list for the future.

author: Alex Vanino
comment: Pretty great app. Love the simplicity and wear integration. Great stuff, the best alarm app!   I did however come across a bug that hides the bottom Options tab/button bar when creating a new alarm. This happens when you create a new alarm and while on the settings screen for that alarm switch to a new screen.   I modified the build.prop on my phone to set the dpi to 540. Could that be an issue?

reply.author: FiveZ
reply.content:
Thanks for your review !
I'll check about button bar being hidden.
EDIT: Hi! The new version fixes this problem.

author: Bhavik Barai
comment: Do you even test app before uploading? I can't click on 'save' button!  So app is totally un useful to me. I'm using Xiaomi Redmi Note 3 with cm14.1...

reply.author: FiveZ
reply.content:
Hi,
I do test the app, but that doesn't mean that all bugs are seen. I of them will be fixed in a few hours.
You can send me an email at fivez.contact [a] gmail.com. Thx!
EDIT: An update is available. Could you please tell me if it fixes your bug?

comment: Actually works under Android 6. Getting better still.

reply.author: FiveZ
reply.content: Thanks! That's really appreciated!

title: Super nice

author: Christian Budka
comment: Just had 2 bucks stolen from me. App crashes, alarms don't go off  and app is super buggy.

reply.author: FiveZ
reply.content:
Of course.
Just send me an email with your order id, and you'll have your refund.
But I've seen no feedback about crashes and the app works well for other users. So I cannot fix what I ignore.
Next version will be out at the end of the week. You'll be able to use the free version and test it without buying the premium pack.

title: Refund?!

author: Sigit Pratomo
comment: So we can test does/how the premium features--like tasker integration--work

reply.author: FiveZ
reply.content:
Hello,
Thanks for your feedback.
I'm open to suggestions about how to do it well :) , as I don't want to open features for 15 days and then block them, making the alarm not ring anymore, for example.

Thanks for your patience!

author: Shaun Scanlon
comment: Happy to see landscape is an option but sadly it doesn't work. Testing shows that the alarm does rotate bit doesn't show the photo I chose, no music is played and the app doesn't allow me to stop the alarm. To do that I have to back out and re enter the app again.

reply.author: FiveZ
reply.content:
Hello, thank for your review.
Could you please send me an email at five.z.contact at gmail.com with your alarms settings and, if possible and not related to private life, the picture that does not displays, so that I can reproduce the issue?
That may be due to low memory at the moment of testing the app or to the picture itself.
Thanks!

title: Landscape and photo issues

author: Georgette Lee
comment: Phenomenally responsive developer! Every new update is better than the last and I am consistently impressed with FiveZ's dedication to the craft. The quality and speed with which the app adapts to change is unsurpassed.

reply.author: FiveZ

reply.content: Hello. May I ask what you do find confused? You can, if you'd like, send an email to five.z.contact [a] gmail.com, so that I can improve the app on this matter.

author: Franklin Ma
comment: Very responsive developer and seems to really take suggestions into account. The alarm app, is becoming a VERY viable alternative to alarm clock extreme. My suggestion is more options for challenges (i.e. for math: customized difficulty and setting certain number of challenges to dismiss). If more types of challenges get added, it would be awesome if it could randomly show you different ones (i.e. math, captcha, simon-like pattern, etc). But as it stands right now, still my absolute favorite alarm app!

reply.author: FiveZ
reply.content: Thank you! I'll keep on improving it!

reply.content: Thanks for your updated review!

title: Only alarm that can set up to skip some and resume automatically

author: Steven Bach
comment: Worked well for a few days, then this morning it didn't trigger. Went into the app to see if I mis-set it somehow and it said "In less than a minute" half an hour after it was supposed to trigger.  UPDATE: After last update, alarms appears to be working correctly!

reply.author: FiveZ
reply.content:
Thanks for your report. I will look into it. Could you please send me an email (five.z.contact at gmail.com) with your alarm's settings and your version of Android so that I can reproduce and correct the problem?
Thanks in advance and please accept my apologies for any inconvenience.
EDIT: thanks for updating your review! That's appreciated!

comment: Material design alarm that goes off at the time you set it. Easy to customize. Responsive developer.

reply.author: FiveZ

title: Material Design Alarm

author: Felicia Hunte
comment: Good idea but a bit too much information in the setting alarm page, may be a bit off putting

reply.author: FiveZ
reply.content:
Thanks for downloading my application! Your feedback is very precious.
The application is constantly improved.
EDIT: the next update is now out and, among others, improves the setting alarm page.

author: Kevin Chan
comment: - cannot disable progressive ring volume.  - cannot set an alarm for a specific date in the future.  - does not support irregular repeat periods.  - cannot set individual snooze periods nor make it progressively shorter.

reply.author: FiveZ
reply.content:
Thanks for your feeback!
You can now (among other things) : 
- Disable the progressive volume using the progressive ringtone checkbox.
- Set an alarm for a specific date by disabling the alarm until this date.
- Set an alarm to repeat every two, three... weeks
- Set individual snooze periods and set decreasing snooze periods

Hope you'll like it!

title: Not as Flexible as Claimed

author: Joe Theisman
comment: Used to be great, but after recent updates I have not been woken up two days in a row.

reply.author: FiveZ
reply.content:
There was a bug that prevented the alarm to ring in some cases. An update has been made available few hours ago that fixes it.
Please accept my deepest apologies.

comment: Failed to alarm and wake me up on two different days. I confirmed the alarms, volumes, etc. I'll stick to Alarmpad

reply.author: FiveZ

Hello,
An update has been released that fix this issue.

Thanks for your patience and have a nice day!

title: You had one job.

comment: No option for no snooze? Not everyone wants or needs snooze. I never continued any further than that. Uninstalled.

So the option is already there. I can help if you'd like.
